title: Please critique!
content:
Hello, I’m working on a font family for a class project that captures a moment passing. The forms for the fonts are based on a video of smoke being blown into soap through a straw and how the bubbles rise to the surface. This is my first attempt at typeface design and I was hoping for some feedback or critique

\>\>\>\>Thanks in advance, any feedback would be really appreciated!

You can view the spec poster here: [http://flickr.com/photos/afarhat/2393880515/sizes/l/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408053226/http:/flickr.com/photos/afarhat/2393880515/sizes/l/ "http://flickr.com/photos/afarhat/2393880515/sizes/l/")  
There are also some other images of the font progress in my photostream.

 [‹ Learning Chinese Typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408053226/http:/typophile.com/node/43925 "Go to previous forum topic") [Muralista Font ! I hope you enjoy! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408053226/http:/typophile.com/node/41657 "Go to next forum topic")
author: iFranksAlot

comments.content: What does your instructor think about this project?

My instructor’s feedback has been mostly positive. Some comments were to work on refining the “bouncing” of the tops of the letters as your eye reads across and to fix the spacing between the letters to be more consistent. I was just hoping to get some suggestions as to how to go about doing that. He had suggested that the class post on typophile to get some feedback.
